item.title: Report X-2025070807
item.description:
Report X-2025070807

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-09
  • City: CANASTOTA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated that while at a customer location he noticed that the commodity was leaking. ABF advised that the commodity was forked while being loaded at the 029 SC. A crew from RS arrived on-site. Following a site assessment, RS personnel noted approximately two (2) gallons of paint stripper released to the interior of the trailer and concrete surface of the parking lot. RS personnel deployed granular absorbents and worked in with hand tools. All paint stripper-impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal, and the damaged pail was placed in one (1) 95-gallon overpack drum as salvaged material for further processing and shipping. RS personnel secured the site and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2025070198
item.description:
Report E-2025070198

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-03
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Other freight was double stacked on top of the drums. While in transit, the pallet shifted slightly causing the end of the pallet to hang over the drums. As the dock worker was attempting to unload the shifted pallet, he punctured the drum. Leadership was immediately notified and hazwoper trained personnel tipped the drum to its side to stop the leak. The drum was patched with putty and placed in an overpack container. All leaked material was contained and cleaned up with absorbents. All contaminated clean up materials were packed into a separate overpack container in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2025070000
item.description:
Report E-2025070000

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-30
  • City: BALDWINSVILLE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The dock worker was stacking a small pallet on top of another small pallet in front of the drums. The dock workers fork blades were sticking out and punctured the drum about 1/2 way up the side of the drum. The dock worker immediately notified leadership which promptly responded to the spill with proper PPE on. The drum was tipped on its side to stop the leak and placed in an overpack container. The spilled liquid was neutralized and cleaned up with absorbents. The absorbents, clean-up materials, and used PPE were placed in separate overpack containers in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2025070391
item.description:
Report E-2025070391

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-18
  • City: EAST SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10918
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 600ft-by-1ft area of concrete between the trailer and soil and a 5ft-by-5ft area of soil and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to the drum being forked. Before the contractor arrived, the facility personnel placed the leaking drum into one (1) 95-gallon steel drum with the top cut off that already contained other absorbent materials. Clean Harbors personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizer to the affected areas. It was determined that a strip of one foot away along the concrete was going to need to be excavated. Seven (7) 55-gallon poly drums of contaminated soil and impacted absorbents were generated. The drums began bulging and it was advised that containment will need to be established around the drums, and they will need to be left outside to vent. The lids were loosened and covered with poly sheeting. The waste was staged onsite before contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2025060050
item.description:
Report I-2025060050

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-01
  • City: TICONDEROGA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GENOX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While removing an empty trailer from customer site, GenOx Driver failed to disconnect safety (whip check) lanyards resulting in hose post (Customer side piping) being pulled down and broken creating a leak of natural gas. Approximately 490,000 SCF was released. Upon notification, Natural Gas decompression skids were remotely emergency stopped, and maintenance technicians dispatched. Upon arrival, NG Advantage Maintenance technicians were able to secure the leak using remote shutoff features on the CNG Trailers. Area was monitored and gas was determined to have disbursed. Piping was isolated and repairs were scheduled and completed at a later date. Note: This was a failure of onsite piping causes by movement of a trailer. At no time did the hazardous material packaging (trailer) fall.
